critique: This document establishes a naval petroleum reserve in the continental shelf and transfers certain functions from the Secretary of Interior to the Secretary of the Navy. It revokes a previous executive order related to the continental shelf. There is no direct indication of ideological tilt, immigration approach, or impact on civil liberties. The order centralizes control over the petroleum reserve at the federal level. It could be argued that setting aside land for oil and gas leans towards deregulation, but it also involves government intervention in resource management. There is no clear indication of social inclusion or exclusion.
